comments.commentBody: Ar'nt you the sweetest!

Oh sure.."an articulable and consistent standard " that causes you to argue that 4-celled blastulas are human beings while supporting a massacre in Iraq that left a million people dead and a country ripped to pieces.

Guess what?

Save it.

"Yes, in a democratic society, we value the convictions of every individual equally, and thus offer every citizen one (and only one) vote."

This of course has led to almost unimaginable suffering and horror. It is the cause of the Iraq bloodbath that left a million people dead. It is the single reason that climate change is being ignored and sensible energy policy is a pipe dream. All for this lunatic "We the people" charade.

Democracy is one of the most poisonous ideas ever conceived. For awhile, there was only so much damage a brainless voting public could do. Now the damage is virtually limitless and the globe is imploding under the weight of this awful idea. Stupid vicious people used to outnumber smart and decent people 2:1. Today the ration is 760,000:1 and climbing steadily.

We can have a democratic system or we can survive. We can't have both. SOME form of central regulation is the only way humans will even have a shot at making it and this has to start with strict controls on population.

Otherwise, forget it. It's over.

I don't know about Paul, but Huntsman was immediately shut out of the money send him the message to butt out.  This was Romney's party, they were sending in the clowns and he didn't want to put on the red nose he had better disappear.  I'm sure he got some commitment to future millions for politics or some put-up job at Bain Capital.  He proved himself by taking the hint.
As opposed to the hundreds of thousands of middle class jobs Romney eliminated at Bain?  Republicans never met a middle class job they didn't want to outsource overseas for cheap labor.

Well, some of us on the right aren't susceptible to crushes anymore, even sardonic ones. From the beginning, it was clear that there were only three Republican candidates that were in any sense truly electable: Romney, Hunstman and Pawlenty; and the latter two quickly demonstrated that they didn't have the legs (or the belly-fire) for it. For months and months now, it's been clear that the Mittster was going to be our man.

So, time for a march somewhere between the reactionary Conservative he needed to appear to be for primary purposes, and the center, which probably is too far-left for him. But wherever he touches down, it'll be salable, and it'll be presidential.

But I can't help feeling more than a twinge of opportunity lost that there were no DEMOCRATIC presidential primaries this season: imagine the opportunities for amusement (and crushes) we've lost by this vacuum; imagine the hilarity that might have been, watching the left fall all over itself cadging primary and caucus votes from liberati extremists that think one endangered snarkle-nosed bandersnatch is worth, oh, 10,000 middle-class jobs.
Officials from Qatar's World Cup organizing committee say the weather will be delightful. "Sure it's 120, but it's a dry 120."
How hot it will be in Las Vegas on August 5 for the Real-Juve match? 120 degrees?
Officials from Qatar's World Cup organizing committee say the weather will be delightful. "Sure it's 120, but it's a dry 120."

You forgot to mention the other side's philosophy... the far left believes that if you don't work, you can always vote to force some other working sucker to feed you.

They will always vote for anybody who can give them the crumbs from the table, as long as they can remain indolent.

Right.

Liberals. The "indolent" ones responsible for EVERY SINGLE ADVANCE in science, music, painting, philosophy, medicine and culture.

I've got an idea.

Why don't you fine Republican evangelicals CREATE something? And I mean--ANYTHING.

Begin with a little toothpick house. Even some gingerbread cookies would be a start.

Instead of destroying—something you have proven your talent for again and again—try to MAKE something.

I'd like to see that. I'd like to see you DO something, rather than attack the liberals whose medicine you use, whose technology you exploit, whose art you ingest without a thought for where every last bit of it comes from.

I think the author missed a huge point about the differences between the far right and the far left.  The most important point is that the far right believes that if you don't work, you don't eat.  They will never vote for a Marxist like Obama or any of the other pinko commie-dupe leftists.
Incompetence compared to who?  The reign of Cheney/Bush and the Neo-Con congressional horde?  Sure they did a lot, but it all turned out wrong in the end.
Rome wasn't built in a day. And eight years of madness isn't undone overnight. It will take generations for America to recover from the crimes of the Bush family.

Actually it's not funny at all. We have a major political party that has wandered off into the mythical realm of St. Ronald the Great, where "facts are stupid things".

With 40% of the electorate busy watching someone chasing a ball, then deciding at the last minute how they feel, it's actually very horrifying.
Very funny.  Now what about writing on the candidate crush still being suffered by you and your colleagues for Barack Obama, despite his all-too-obvious incompetence?
dont waste your time. it was some low budget bush era antiwar nonsense. the US isn't going to war with iran.

Let's quit telling other countries what to do about Iran. We are the ones who have the wrong headed attitude towards Iran. Full and free trade with Iran is the quickest way to dethrone the mullahs. But, if we did that, we would have to find another boogeyman.
People like Romney react in a cowardly fashion because they are cowards.

Hillary is wasting time talking to someone as inept as Mamata Banerjee. She single handed set Bengal 50 years back by her militant opposition of the Tata factory and Indonesian factories. She is also the biggest opposition to foreign investment in India. She is worse than the communists that were ruling before (who were no good either). My prediction is that Mamata's reign is short lived and soon it will the commies taking over. Bengal is doomed either way.

No sane person supports killing. I condemn all sorts of atrocities done on any human being. Having said that, I will also like to point out that people all over the world are creating such a ruckus over Godhra killing, does it occur to any one to question why Godhra killing happened? A compartment load of hundreds of Hindu women and children were Burnt Alive by Muslim fanatics without any provocation! When those charred bodies arrived in Godhra, Hindus were upset and there was this riot. It is alright that people want justice for Muslims. But should justice be one sided? Has any one ever expressed regret for the Hindus? Muslims started it. Should not the world condemn them first and seek justice for the burnt Hindus?

It is an open secret. Narendra Modi allowed the massacres against Muslims by his blatant inaction. The government, ministers and it's officers are sworn to uphold law and order. They need to act when lives are in danger. But legally, inaction is much harder to prove than action especially when the entire bureaucratic machinery under Modi sides with him. They have to because they are complicit in these massacres by their inaction. No court or investigative committee will ever find Modi guilty enough to put him behind bars. That's just the sad truth.

Who is this mysterious "outside expert"? Has anyone investigated them to make sure they are not fronting for the Congress or other potlitical rivals? Seems a bit like kanagroo justince when one verdict after another is rejected in a never ending quest to indict Modi who has now been found not guilty by multiple panels and commissions
you're blinded by your fandom.

Stu, you wrote: "hockey is much more than numbers, as you know."

But you don't actually believe that. You looked at the final won-loss record in the series - numbers - and you made all kind of conclusions to justify that outcome.

You're wrong to then sneer at Saget's numbers as though they're somehow invalid.

Rob, now we all know how smart you are. Thanks! Too cool for school.

The problem is that sales tax laws have not been updated to account for online purchases. As such, Amazon enjoys an enormous competitive advantage over any retail location, at a great detriment to the states in which these goods are sold.

Congress should do something to amend the appropriate collection of sales tax, which should obviously be done at the purchase level within Amazon. When questioned whether they could do this, Amazon replied that it was too complicated. Perhaps you believe that this is truly is beyond Amazon's technical capability, but I would wager you're in the minority.
You're clinging too tight to an old fashion business model, Fred.  Adapt or die.

The article is about obese passengers.  That is why the comments are related to obese people and flight safety.  It is the central thesis of the article.  Also, 15% body fat for a man is actually high.

I would do a happy dance if we were in danger of becoming a nation of over-muscled bodybuilders.

Clearly, that is not the direction in which we are heading.

San Antonio, 50 miles from you, pops up near the top of a simple Google search for obesity rankings.

The facts are the facts.

crass and heartless? gee, no. in fact, as a disabled person who's confined to a wheelchair, I can't wait until the FAA follows your advice! btw sir, exactly when and how did you come to determine that our lives are more disposable than the skinny or able-bodied?

your jaw-dropping ignorance is galling...

Millions of people suffer from an addictive disorder, be it drinking or eating or gambling or sex or any number of others.

Then there are those who confuse their blessed good fortune with superiority.

Is it possible that there are two kinds of obesity? One resulting from voluntary self-neglect, the other from a difference in the way one's body metabolizes food? Would that be too complicated?

Regina may think it's reasonable for airlines to ban obese people from flying unless and until they lose weight, but I think it's discriminatory.  And if they're flying, they should fly safely.  Is this really even in question?  Call it disability or whatever you want, but make the airlines adjust so we're all safe in the air.

What about pregnant women? I'm pretty tiny (5' 1", 110 pounds) but gained nearly 30 pounds with each of my pregnancies. I would have definitely been an impediment to quickly exiting the airplane, just simply based on being clumsy from the awkward distribution of weight.

But I have many friends who are of larger, but similar proportions --and they can easily surpass the 175 pound mark. Do we ban pregnant women from flying, too, based on safety reasons? (I'm actually okay with it -- would have loved to have an excuse to not fly for work -- but it does open up a whole different "class" to consider).
